article_metadata.text_summary_en: This text describes a CNN television program that will revisit the Oklahoma City bombing on April 19, 1995. The bombing was carried out by Timothy McVeigh, a U.S. army veteran, who detonated a truck bomb outside the Alfred Murrah Federal Building, resulting in the deaths of 168 people. The program will examine the events leading up to this domestic terrorist attack, the largest in U.S. history.
